attributes.action: End the 'Special Relationship' with the USA in the event of a Trump presidency.
attributes.background: After 580,000 petitioned to ban his entry into the UK, Trump may become president. Our Special Relationship means the British people may be dragged into economic, political and military conflict by a hated man. In this time of vulnerability, the UK must distance itself from Trump's America.
attributes.additional_details: In a campaign mired in racism, xenophobia, extremism, and sexual assault, Donald Trump has outlined plans which, due to the US/UK 'Special Relationship', may endanger British citizens and interests. This includes nuclear proliferation in Korea and Japan, the abandonment of NATO, forcing Mexico to pay for a border wall, ground troops in Syria, torture, opposition to China, and potential war with Iran and North Korea. If Trump wins, the UK must take a stand against his administration.

attributes.action: Bring back public information films showing the dangers HGV drivers face
attributes.background: HGV drivers are constantly put in danger due to the way that other road users behave toward us when a car joins a motorway or pulls out into the line of on coming HGVs and explaining safe distances
attributes.additional_details: Increasing dash cam footage found on most online forums within the industry

attributes.action: Raise university tuition fees using current CPI, not forecasted RPIX
attributes.background: This petition urges the government to use CPI (currently at 0.5%) to increase tuition fees instead of the 2.8% forecasted rate from the Office of Budget Responsibility. This rate will benefit students more, whilst also covering the cost of inflation for universities.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the HE Bill universities are already publishing new tuition fees of £9250 per year, an increase of just under 2.8%. Currently, no rate of inflation published by ONS is close to 2.8% and RPIX, the rate the government is making calculations on, is only 1.5%. 2.8% is a 10 year forecast for RPIX. To put tutition fees in line with inflation a new tuition fee should be calculated each year using CPI figures at the time.

attributes.action: Make age appropriate basic life support mandatory in the national curriculum.
attributes.background:
Give all children a chance to be life savers with age appropriate basic life support mandatory in the national curriculum in every school year.
Starting with getting help, calling 999, and going on to Asthma, Anaphylaxis, AEDs, CPR, Choking, and more.
attributes.additional_details: AEDs are automated external defibrillators, safe to use and already found in many published places such as train stations and malls.

attributes.action: Urgently review age-based referrals for breast cancer screening women under 30.
attributes.background:
Under 30's automatically considered as non-urgent referral of up to 3 months.

Over 30's can expect to be seen within days/weeks.

Both can have same symptoms. 

This needs to change.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.edinburghnews.scotsman.com/news/health/mum-with-breast-cancer-urges-women-to-trust-their-instincts-1-4089771

https://www.gofundme.com/breastiesin20s

attributes.action: Abolish Inheritance Tax.  It is wrong to tax assets that have already been taxed
attributes.background:
We believe that Inheritance Tax should be abolished. It is a tax on assets that have already been taxed. 
People should be free to leave their assets to whomsoever they want without fear of being taxed again. 
We believe that the Government should be bold enough to act and axe this iniquitous tax

attributes.action: Make it illegal for event tickets to be sold at more than Face Value.
attributes.background: Over the past 15 - 20 years it has become almost impossible to buy an event ticket for Face Value, companies like Ticketmaster etc are ticket touts of the worse kind. Not only do they increase the cost of the ticket they also add extra's e.g. handling fee, transaction costs, delivery.
attributes.additional_details:
Recent example: GetMeIn a Ticketmaster company: 2 x £55 Robbie Williams Tickets. £97.90 each, plus £35.88 transaction fee. Total for two tickets £231.68 
THIS IS DAYLIGHT ROBBERY & SHOULD BE ILLEGAL
Surely the venue has agreed on the original ticket price and this price has been set to cover all costs and overheads, therefore who, in this particular case benefits from the extra £121.68
Sporting Events:  VIVAGO ar offering Six Nations Tickets for Wales v England £75 tickets for £190 each

attributes.action: Inculde more safety elements in the driving test towards motorcycle awareness
attributes.background: too often cars drift around their lanes freely instead of staying straight, especially when moving slowly, this makes filtering through traffic Dangerous! Car drivers pay very little attention to motorcyclist. While I was learning to drive a car, not one thing was ever mentioned about a motorbike!
attributes.additional_details:
I personally have been hit by 2 cars within 2 years and neither of them were my fault, this could be easily avoided if people where taught about motorcyclists while learning to drive! I have witnessed more times than I care to count, cars use their full acceleration in traffic to move from a slow moving lane to a faster moving lane without thought of a motorcycle. They do this as they are not taught about about motorcyclist! This WILL save lives.

Thanks you for reading and please sign & share

attributes.action: Stop funding charities that pay executives and employees  excessive wages
attributes.background:
Charities are funded & given huge sums of money from the government with out any conditions & this money is rarely used for the purpose it was intended
instead it is mostly put in the pockets of its employees in the form of extortionate wages employee wages including executives should be capped
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2550648/Fury-234-000-salary-boss-Save-Children-Charity-chiefs-huge-wages-reined-say-MPs.html

attributes.action: Take military action against the Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's Government.
attributes.background: 3 years ago, Parliament rejected a Gov. motion to take action against the Syrian Gov., after receiving evidence of the use of Chemical weapons against the Syrian people. We ask Parliament to reconsider its position following more recent reports of war crimes, including summary killings of civilians.
attributes.additional_details: In 2013, the UN confirmed that the Syrian Government had used chemical weapons against the Syrian people. In recent days there have been increased concerns that the Syrian army and their military supporters are committing both humanitarian and war crimes, including the massacring of families in cold blood. We urge Parliament to approve military action, in order to help in relieving Syrian civilians of their plight, and to deter the Syrian Government from committing such crimes against them.

attributes.action: Make humira free to patients with the eye condition uvietus
attributes.background: Uvietus can make people lose their eyesight , humira is known to settle the uvietus down and stop it flaring up giving the patient a chance of getting their eyes operated on , ie cataract operation. This drug is free in Scotland and Wales but not from NHS England . Why

attributes.action: Establish a 7 day celebration of tireless efforts by NHS workers 365 days a year
attributes.background: My mum recently attended Hospital for a hip replacement where she was cared for by many wonderful NHS workers over a five day period including a weekend. I felt that my few words of appreciation to the staff needed reinforcing through a national campaign aimed at thanking all NHS workers in the UK.

attributes.action: Prevent privatisation of any aspect of Children's Protective Services in the UK
attributes.background: Children deserve to be protected by a system that is not privately controlled and therefore accountable to shareholders. Children's Protective Services must remain within Local Authority control as a Statutory Duty to protect children from avoidable harm.
attributes.additional_details:
Privitisation may allow confused prioritIes for providers that could lead to vulnerable children being abused.

We all have a duty to safeguard children which is a public necessity not a private and financial one.

attributes.action: Do not allow the sale of our utilities to foreign companies
attributes.background: A Chinese consortium are trying to purchase a majority stake in National Grid's £11billion gas distribution network. The Prime Minister promised tighter regulations on foreign investments in the UK, it seems to be an empty promise. Our utilities need to stay under British control. Sign if you agree.

attributes.action: The UK government must condemn the Ethiopian government's treatment of the Oromo
attributes.background: We believe that the UK government should stop enabling the Ethiopian government and that they should support calls for an international, and independent investigation into the treatment of the Oromo people. Most recently this has lead to the death of 23 Oromo prisoners in a fire.
attributes.additional_details:
The Oromo people are the largest ethnic group in Ethiopia and make up 40% of the population. They have experienced discrimination at the hands of the government which has been dominated by the minority ethnic group Tigray for decades. 

The situation in Ethiopia has become increasingly unstable since security forces repeatedly fired upon protests in the Amhara and Oromia regions in August 2016. 

For more info: https://www.hrw.org/news/2016/09/08/joint-letter-un-human-rights-council-ethiopia

attributes.action: Make June 23 a bank holiday to celebrate UK Independence Day.
attributes.background: To celebrate the EU referendum historic result where the people of the UK voted to regain independence from the EU.
attributes.additional_details: The people have spoken and voted for a self Governing UK. This wonderful example of democratic success deserves to be remembered forever. A bank holiday would enable the people to celebrate the occasion.

attributes.action: Make our Waters Safe- Licensing and Alcohol Regulation of Watercraft
attributes.background: The Railways & Transportation Safety Act of 2003 in Section 80 already starts to cover the control of being under the influence, all it needs is to be signed by the Minister of Shipping (Robert Goodwill MP) for it to be enforced. This can then also be expanded into licensing watercraft.
attributes.additional_details:
British Waters are one of only a few that don’t require a license to operate leisure craft on the water, nor is there any regulation on being under the influence of alcohol or drugs. Most European countries, Australia and the USA all require a license to operate a vessel on the water. The US Coastguard name alcohol in their top five contributing factors of accidents. 
Lives at sea matter. We have legislation for our roads, why not our waters. 
For more info: www.facebook.com/makeourwaterssafe

attributes.action: Change the way in which property is bought and sold in England
attributes.background: My family and I have recently been left in a bad position, because of a supposedly reliable cash buyer pulling out of purchasing our flat, a week before we were going to be moving into our newly built family home.
attributes.additional_details: I would like a legally binding contract in place at an earlier stage (for example when a price is agreed) during the property buying and selling process. This will give the seller the confidence to start spending money on their next purchase, and not be worrying about if the buyer is going to back out. If a buyer then backs out without good reason then they will be liable for all the costs that the seller has incurred, and the buyer should also lose their deposit.

attributes.action: Make appropriate sex education for LGBT+ people mandatory in schools.
attributes.background: We, as young people, have very limited access to sex education in school...so when it comes to sex education regarding LGBT+ people, there is essentially nothing! This needs to change or more than just people's education could be negatively impacted. People's health could be at great risk!
attributes.additional_details: We had to visit specific charities and organisations to receive any information regarding LGBT+ sexual health. This is just not okay as it puts people at risk and creates a separation between peers (solely due to their sexuality/gender).

attributes.action: Commence an urgent review of the Child Maintenance Service Policies/Procedures.
attributes.background: The service levels offered by the Child Maintenance Service are exceptionally poor, staff are unhelpful and do not carry out instructions within reasonable timescales.  Also, the use of Gross Income in the calculations is unfair and takes no account of paying parents financial circumstances.
attributes.additional_details: I have suffered from numerous issues created by this agency and am being financially disadvantaged by them and I am sure I am not alone.  Whilst the majority of paying parents have no issue paying maintenance, it is unfair and unjust that payments do not take into account the financial circumstances of either the paying or the receiving parent.

attributes.action: Review family courts and cafcass mode of operation and predjudicial views.
attributes.background: A request that a Parliamentary commitee be set up to review the way family courts are conducted, the basis of evidence that they and cafcass depend on to make decisions, and the way family courts and CAFCASS are biased towards the mothers wishes over the fathers, more importantly the childs needs.
attributes.additional_details:
It is widely viewed amongst society that fathers are heavily penalised in child contact cases, and that all support is heavily biased towards mothers. 

Many fathers are wrongfully accused and a scan of mothers forums show evidence of collaboration in what accusations to make to prevent/limit contact. CAFCASS are complicit in these activities and their case workers highly prejudiced. Mothers are not held accountable for falsifying accusations.

attributes.action: Gather international support to pressure Saudi Arabia to stop funding Wahabbism.
attributes.background: Saudia Arabia has openly funded Wahabbism since the 1970s. Wahabbism is the extremist branch of Islam that promotes terrorism and jihad. This government should seriously rethink its relationship with Saudi Arabia and garner international support to stop the spreading of this destructive ideology.

attributes.action: Urinary Tract Infections tested for and prescribed for by a pharmacist not a GP.
attributes.background: A UTI can be debilitating, testing and treatment at a pharmacy saves women the hassle of waiting for an appointment or call back from the GP for a prescription of antibiotics. It would save the NHS the cost and time of a GP testing and prescribing for a UTI.
attributes.additional_details: I have suffered with a UTI during NHS out of hours and had to travel (in pain) many miles for treatment. It can take 24 hours or more to receive treatment, much of which wastes NHS time and has caused myself and other women a great deal of distress. If I could be tested and treated solely at a pharmacy it would save many women time and pain and would save wasting GP time.

attributes.action: Stop Govia Thameslink( GTR) from being allowed to increase fares in 2017
attributes.background:
Govia Thameslink the owners of Southern Rail have consistently failed to provide a service which could be considered acceptable in any reasonable way. 
With both individuals and businesses losing millions they should not be allowed to raise fares when they are not providing a proper service.
attributes.additional_details:
With well documented proof that they have consistently failed to provide a proper service, have left passengers stranded and have cost individuals & businesses millions in lost revenue collectively the owners of Southern Rail should have no automatic right to increase fares when they have failed miserably to provide an acceptable service for the last 8 months of 2016. 

This issue has been raised in the house several times and is public knowledge.

attributes.action: Increase the standard paid length of Paternity Leave in the UK to 4 weeks.
attributes.background:
I have recently completed 2 weeks Paternity Leave after my first child was born. 
It really isn't enough time, the time it takes to properly bond with your child is vastly beyond what is currently allowed. 
It should be totally optional but I believe the government should increase the paid time.

attributes.action: Send aid and health trained volunteers into Aleppo to help with current crisis.
attributes.background: Aleppo deserves help, we have already turned our backs once before by making it clear England doesn't want refugees, bombing needs to stop. There is no hospitals left. It's a human rights violation. send them aid- medicine, shelter, food, drink, clothes and volunteers trained in health care
attributes.additional_details: Every single day people are dying in Aleppo. Watch the news

attributes.action: Ask the Treasury to abolish the proposed company car tax changes.
attributes.background: The Government have pushed the public to buy "clean cars" via grants and tax breaks. Thousands of drivers including myself have followed their advice and incentives to purchase. They are now looking tax us for following their advice - The changes are unjust and a u-turn leaving us out of pocket.
attributes.additional_details:
Many of us have made the decision to buy a more expensive hybrid car because UKGOV asked us to by offering financial contributions and tax breaks. My family and I, (like many others) are now facing greater tax bills than I had with my previous diesel vehicle - How is this fair? I feel the public have been miss-sold and miss-guided by UKGOV. 

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3909606/Company-car-drivers-face-paying-thousands-tax-new-plans-announced-month.html

attributes.action: Make it illegal to produce and use products made of non-recyclable plastic
attributes.background: We need to stop thinking that plastic waste is being dealt with to the degree at which it is advertised. We do not need non-recyclable plastic, and this is evident by the amount we only use once - then throw away every day.
attributes.additional_details: A large amount of plastics marked 'recyclable' are not recycled in the UK (mostly mixed plastics) and are instead sent abroad to be disposed of. As a result of this, we need to open far more facilities capable of processing and recycling mixed plastics. Our use of non-recyclable plastic is unsustainable, irresponsible and unnecessary.

attributes.action: Make it legal that disabled people travelling in wheelchairs need a head rest
attributes.background: I would like to make it legal for all disabled people travelling in wheelchairs to have a head rest for safety reasons. All car seats now have head rests and children in car seats must have head/neck support so why discriminate a disabled person by not supplying them with head/neck support.
attributes.additional_details: Please help by signing this petition

attributes.action: Introduce a nationwide carbon tax applying to both citizens and corporations.
attributes.background: This petition is a call for politicians to take action against the threat of climate change before it is too late. We are calling for nationwide taxation on all activities and products contributing to the emission of carbon dioxide, which would set our country on the path to a sustainable future.

attributes.action: Establish a list of acredited Business Consultants/Mentor organisations.
attributes.background: Business Consultants offer valuable advice to government and SMEs yet remain unregulated.  It is proposed that when engaging, recommending, or working with Business Consultants government bodies and SMEs should be able to refer to an approved provider list of organisations and agencies.
attributes.additional_details: SMEs are seen as the growth engine of the economy yet there is little information for the inexperienced to identify who are credible business consultants and who are not.  There is no overarching governance mechanism, and yet we see numerous initiatives and grants seeking to help this sector. To this extent making available a list of accrediting organisations who exercise not only a quality control scheme for their members but ongoing educational programmes, for example as offered by, the Association of Business Mentor (a body of professional mentors) or such organisations as ibd Business Advice Group (ibd-uk.com – a group of business consultants) would protect both end user and provider.

attributes.action: A database for compulsive gamblers to register to, banning further gambling
attributes.background: Gambling addictions are often underestimated in their control over individuals and the devastating impacts on the victim, family and friends. Effects of gambling unfortunately can include lost life savings, pensions, subsequent divorces and homelessness among many others.
attributes.additional_details: Gambling sites, advertisements, constant emails and the availability of gambling make it increasingly difficult for a compulsive gambler to resist the compulsion to gamble. Many people want to give up, the problem is the temptation, current protection offered by sites is not good enough. I propose a national data base where addicts can register to say they wish to be banned from all sites and casinos, it is then the responsibility of the sites or casinos to check this database to protect users

attributes.action: Legalize Cannabis Oil and use it in the NHS to help people suffering from Cancer
attributes.background: Cannabis Oil itself is able to cure Cancer and there is enough evidence and research to prove so. if this was legalized and put into the NHS,the amount of patients suffering from cancer would decrease and would effectively save people from Cancer.
attributes.additional_details:
also, the reason that cannabis oil (from cannabis) is not used to cure and kill cancer because it is a plant, and cannot be patented, which means pharmaceutical companies cannot make profit off it.

http://www.mirror.co.uk/news/world-news/government-finally-admits-cannabis-kills-6303176

https://www.cancertutor.com/index8/

http://www.cureyourowncancer.org/how-cannabis-oil-works.html

attributes.action: Abolish University Tuition Fees
attributes.background: In 2012 the Coalition Government raised tuition fees to £9000 a year, which means students now face crippling debt. This shackling debt often lasts decades. Free education is a right not a privilege. We have to act now to take back what's rightfully ours!
attributes.additional_details: Young students eager to better themselves as people are facing crippling debt after they leave university unless they are born of a very wealthy family. This ensures that the wealth stays with the families who have always had it. Worse still is the number of young people denied the chance of university due to their disadvantaged background. Free education is vital if we are to have a country that utilises the most talented rather than the most fortunate. Free education is necessary for equality.

attributes.action: Extreme vetting of immigrants and visitors to the UK
attributes.background: I would like to call for "extreme" ideological vetting of immigrants seeking admission to the UK. People coming to this country must decry their former way of life, and agree to live under a FREE Society who allow FREEDOM OF SPEECH!
attributes.additional_details:
Hate Speech should equally mean HATE speech against Jews and Christians too ... not just islam. It needs to be stated categorically that islam is NOT a race, it is made of many races, just as Christianity is.
People entering should undergo a test, and have to prove they will no longer follow the laws they left. Implementing the policy overhaul would require a temporary halt in immigration from "the most dangerous and volatile regions of the world that have a history of exporting terrorism

attributes.action: Establish and fund a national Hate Crime Task Force.
attributes.background: Parliament should form and fund a national hate crime task force to tackle the unprecedented rise in hate related crime and incidents against minority groups, since the vote to leave the EU. Police and the Judiciary should be provided all necessary resources to investigate and prosecute offences.
attributes.additional_details: Leave or Remain - Not in our name. We have seen a startling rise in both reported and unreported acts of hatred and violence towards sections of our communities "identified" by offenders as "Non-British". Whilst millions of British people may have voted to leave the EU, they do not, and would never, condone this behaviour. We all, and our government has an irrefutable responsibility to challenge and prevent these deplorable acts, with all the force of the law.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for rail fares to rise without inflation and improved services
attributes.background: Every year the public has to pay more to travel on a train network that is not contributing back to the paying customers who along with businesses rely on the efficient running of the railway, delays cancellations and strikes are increasing in number and action needs to be taken rapidly.

attributes.action: A legal aid framework for victims in the case of IVP dataset compromises.
attributes.background: The Investigatory Powers Bill requires the creation of huge datasets of citizens online activity. These datasets will be a very tempting target for criminals. The Government should create a legal aid framework that will help any victims in the case of these datasets being compromised.
attributes.additional_details: We realise that as much attention to security will be given as possible in terms of protecting the hardware and the software protecting this data. This does not mean however that a compromise is not possible and attention needs to be given to what will happen in the event of a compromise and what aid can be given to victims. The framework for this aid should be discussed and a framework formalised in advance so that it is clear to each citizen what help and redress they may seek.

attributes.action: Initiate a Parliamentary Inquiry into the UK Insurance Industry
attributes.background:
The UK Insurance Industry operates under practices which are in direct contrast to the interests of its customers.
Involving multiple entities in any single claim increases costs which are passed on to the policy holder's insurer.  
Cases are settled to avoid costs in spite of no fault situations
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/money/blog/2012/sep/14/insurance-companies-defraud-us

http://www.thetimes.co.uk/tto/money/insurance/article4632734.ece

http://www.mindfulmoney.co.uk/mindful-news/an-end-to-auto-renewals-insurers-forced-to-provide-premium-comparison/

http://www.spectator.co.uk/2015/10/the-car-insurance-industry-is-a-disgusting-racket/

http://www.emeraldinsight.com/doi/abs/10.1016/S1529-2096%2806%2907002-7

http://uk.practicallaw.com/2-200-4590?q=&qp=&qo=&qe=

attributes.action: primary schools to teach kids private parts are private, and don't keep secrets
attributes.background: help prevent child abuse, if children no from a young age that private parts are private an don't keep secret games this can help prevent child abuse no matter how much you trust the person who looks after your child you can never totally be sure, a lot of child abuse is done by a family member.
attributes.additional_details: Please help me an sign this petition an share it, I couldn't help some one who is very close to me but this might be able to help someone else !!

attributes.action: Debate Autism and Employment
attributes.background: As somebody on the Autism Spectrum I currently claim Jobseeker's Allowance and I feel that I have not been given any support to look for a job and they don't understand Autism or how to help people like me to get into employment.
attributes.additional_details: There needs to be people trained in Autism within the DWP as the advisors I have seen do not seem to understand people like me at all, this leads to me feeling very emotional and stressed out, and I dread attending the jobcentre as I really dislike being there, you literally get 5 minutes to be seen then your out the door.

attributes.action: Don't allow Abu Hamza back in the country to serve his prison sentence
attributes.background:
Abu Hamza is currently serving a jail sentence in America.  For many years, this preacher of hate was allowed to spout his vile and repugnant views. 
We believe that he should not be allowed back in the country to serve his sentence and should serve it in the US.

attributes.action: Put a statue of Diane Abbott MP in the Palace of Westminster's Central Lobby.
attributes.background:
A full sized bronze statue should be commissioned and placed in the Central Lobby of the Palace of Westminster to honour Diane Abbott MP.
As the first black woman to have a seat in the House of Commons and a faithful public servant she is an inspiration to us all; astonishingly resilient and brave.

attributes.action: Protect consumers who experience emission problems with their diesel vehicles
attributes.background: Since 2009 diesel vehicles have been fitted with a diesel particulate filter (DPFs) to remove particles of soot etc from the exhaust to protect the environment and the air we breathe. These filters are failing or becoming clogged up and consumers are being presented with costly repair bills.
attributes.additional_details:
I personally was advised that to repair my Honda Civic which was under 4 years old and had covered 33000 miles the cost would be over £3600. Almost 20% of its cost new. Correspondence with Honda UK proved unsuccessful. Some manufacturers do not include DPF's in their warranties. 

I would like to see Manufacturers being forced to give 
1) A retrospective guarantee on DPF's for a period of 10 years or 150,000 miles
2) To recall all vehicles sold since 2009 and test the DPFs, compensating owners

attributes.action: Enact schedule 6 of the 2009 Welfare Reform Act on Joint Birth Registration.
attributes.background: S.111 of the Adoption & Children Act 2002 demonstrated a turning point in Family Law, permitting unmarried fathers to obtain parental responsibility if their name is registered on their child's birth certificate. However, responsibility for registering the birth still lies mainly with the mother.
attributes.additional_details: In England & Wales every year around 7% of births are solely registered by mothers meaning upto 45,000 children do not have their father named on their birth certificate. Research shows that fathers' impact on their children is central to the child's healthy development. With rapidly changing social infrastructures there is a growing trend away from marriage and towards cohabitation. JBR will reinforce the important role fathers play in their children's lives, both practically and symbolically.

attributes.action: Esophageal cancer awareness day!
attributes.background:
Esophageal cancer is rare aggressive form of cancer.
People with esophageal cancer may experience the following symptoms or signs. Sometimes people with esophageal cancer do not show any of these symptoms. 
having a mandatory camera at the age of 50-55 is ideal
attributes.additional_details:
*Difficulty and pain with swallowing, particularly when eating meat, bread, or raw vegetables.
*Even liquid may be painful to swallow.
*Pressure or burning in the chest
*Indigestion or heartburn
*Vomiting
*Frequent choking on food
*Unexplained weight loss
*Coughing or hoarseness
*Pain behind the breastbone or in the throat

We need to make the endoscope camera mandatory for persistent cases, also we need to spread the word so having a national esophageal awareness day would be awesome!

attributes.action: Require that MPs leaving their political party resign their seat immediately.
attributes.background:
This gives the electorate of that constituency the proper opportunity to express their mandate again, rather than having to wait for the next general election. 

It also provides the resigning MP with a mandate to continue (as an independent, or in another party), should they be re-elected.

attributes.action: Change the age to 25 for the sale of Fireworks
attributes.background: If the law was to change to make it illegal to sell to anyone under 25, I'm confident the constant noise on non celebrating days (Fireworks nt, Diwali & New Year's Eve) would dwindle away. Fireworks started 22/10 until 10/12 & back again 24/12 in Dagenham. They're a nuisance especially to Pets.
attributes.additional_details:
How many reports have we seen this year alone about children being injured by other children launching fireworks at them? As usual to many.
Why are supermarkets allowed to advertise "sales" on Fireworks from 7/11/16? 
In this day & age why can't fireworks be made to make minimal noise?

attributes.action: Establish a Financial Services Tribunal to resolve customer disputes.
attributes.background: Major banks and other financial services institutions are often in dispute with customers who deserve protection. Access to court is costly. The FOS ombudsman scheme is inadequate. The FCA is not equipped to resolve disputes. Tribunals offer scrutiny, justice and censure which deters misconduct.

attributes.action: 25 Year Old and over to pay less than £2000 on car insurance
attributes.background: Over 25s should be paying less car insurance as they are unlikely to cause accidents by showing off on the roads they are more wiser and with more experience.
